intro: Apodytes bebile, commonly known as the African sand verbena, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowering period usually occurs during the rainy season, producing vibrant purple or pink blooms. Apodytes bebile is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
